articles.title: BE-FAST: Recognizing the Early Signs of a Stroke
articles.author: Dr. Bhavana Neuro Care

content.heading: Why Early Recognition Matters
content.text: A stroke is a medical emergency where every second counts. Early recognition and immediate treatment can prevent severe brain damage and improve recovery.

content.heading: What Does BE-FAST Mean?
content.text: BE-FAST is a simple method to recognize the most common warning signs of a stroke.

content.heading: B – Balance
content.text: Sudden dizziness or loss of coordination.

content.heading: E – Eyes
content.text: Sudden vision problems in one or both eyes.

content.heading: F – Face Drooping
content.text: One side of the face may droop or feel numb.

content.heading: A – Arm Weakness
content.text: Weakness or numbness in an arm or leg.

articles.title: Living with Epilepsy: Myths vs. Facts
articles.author: Dr. Bhavana Neuro Care

content.heading: Understanding Epilepsy
content.text: Epilepsy is a neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures.

content.heading: Myth vs Fact
content.text: Epilepsy is common and most people with epilepsy live normal, productive lives.

content.heading: Management
content.text: Medication and lifestyle adjustments can effectively control seizures in many individuals.

articles.title: Not Just a Headache: When to See a Doctor for Your Migraine
articles.author: Dr. Bhavana Neuro Care

content.heading: Understanding Migraines
content.text: Migraines are a neurological condition, not just common headaches.

content.heading: When to Seek Help
content.text: Frequent, severe, or worsening headaches should be evaluated by a neurologist.

content.heading: Treatment
content.text: Personalized treatment plans can significantly improve quality of life.

articles.title: Simple Steps to Keep Your Spine Healthy
articles.author: Dr. Bhavana Neuro Care

content.heading: Why Spine Health Matters
content.text: The spine supports movement, posture, and protects the nervous system.

content.heading: Daily Habits
content.text: Good posture, regular exercise, and correct lifting techniques protect the spine.

content.heading: Medical Advice
content.text: Persistent back pain or neurological symptoms require professional evaluation.
